uk.gov.gchq.palisade.user.service

Interface UserService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Service
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HashMapUserService, NullUserService, ProxyRestUserService, RestUserServiceV1

    public interface UserService
extends Service

    The core API for the user service.

    The responsibility of the user service is to maintain the mapping between currently active user IDs and the users they correspond to. Each user has a given ID which can be added to the user service and retrieved later by the client.

    Please note that it is not the responsibility of any UserService implementation to provide the authentication of individual users, or to maintain a database of 'Palisade' users. The actual authentication of users should provided by an external service outside of Palisade. For example, this could be via a centralised PKI service or by a SASL/Kerberos implementation.

    • Method Detail

      • getUser

        CompletableFuture<User> getUser(GetUserRequest request)
                         throws NoSuchUserIdException
        Look up a user by their ID. The request contains the UserId to lookup from the UserService. If the requested UserId doesn't exist in this UserService then an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        request - specifying the user ID to look up
        Returns:
        a CompletableFuture which will be fulfilled with the user details
        Throws:
        NoSuchUserIdException - if the contained UserId could not be found

      • addUser

        CompletableFuture<Boolean> addUser(AddUserRequest request)
        Adds the contained user to the UserService. The given request will contain the User which should be fully populated with all the necessary roles and justifications.
        Parameters:
        request - the request specifying the user with details to add
        Returns:
        a CompletableFuture which will complete as $true once the user has been added

      • process

        default CompletableFuture<?> process(Request request)
        Specified by:
        process in interface Service
